Uses of Class
shellshocker.Boundary

    • Uses of Boundary in shellshocker

      Subclasses of Boundary in shellshocker 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Doors
      Creates door objects that can be opened by the user to allow access to different areas of the game map.
      class  ElectricBounds
      Creates objects that the user and enemies cannot pass through. If the user's character makes contact with the objects, health points are lost.
      class  Platforms
      Creates platform objects that the user, enemies, and boxes can exist without falling to areas of the game map. Platform objects have attributes of location.
      Methods in shellshocker that return types with arguments of type Boundary 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.ArrayList<Boundary> ScanIn.scanInBounds()
      Returns an ArrayList full of Boundary objects after scanning data in from a text file.
      Method parameters in shellshocker with type arguments of type Boundary 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean Ragnar.canMoveDown(java.util.ArrayList<Boundary> boundList, java.util.ArrayList<EnemySprite> enemyList, java.util.ArrayList<Reactor> reactorList) 
      boolean Ragnar.canMoveLeft(java.util.ArrayList<Boundary> boundList, java.util.ArrayList<EnemySprite> enemyList, java.util.ArrayList<Reactor> reactorList)
      Checks to find whether or not the main character can move to the left. Potential objects that inhibit movement include walls, platforms, doors, and enemies.
